intro: Morinda batesii, commonly known as the white morinda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically orange to red in color when mature. Morinda batesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
